thread.title: Syracuse Crunch defenseman headed to Tampa Bay
thread.title_full: Syracuse Crunch defenseman headed to Tampa Bay

author: Lindsay Kramer | lkramer@syracuse.com
title: Syracuse Crunch defenseman headed to Tampa Bay
text:
Syracuse Crunch defenseman headed to Tampa Bay 2015-03-21-sdc-crunchcomets.JPG Syracuse Crunch defenseman Slater Koekkoek played in three NHL games with Tampa Bay as a rookie last season and should get a chance for more soon after the Lightning recalled him on Friday. (Stephen D. Cannerelli) Comments 
Second-year defenseman Slater Koekkoek practiced with the Syracuse Crunch on Friday and then packed his gear for a trip to Tampa Bay. 
Koekkoek will help fill a hole created on Thursday night when Victor Hedman was injured in a game against Dallas. Also, blueliner Nikita Nesterov was tossed from that contest after a questionable hit and might face an NHL suspension. 
Koekkoek, a first-round pick by the Lightning in 2012, was among the final groups of cuts from Tampa Bay to Syracuse this preseason. 
"I'm excited and just hope I can do everything to get Tampa back winning and see what I can do,'' Koekkoek said Friday afternoon. "You kind of get looking at positions and you that they've got a lot of great d-men there, older d-men. So I knew I was going to start in Syracuse and am thankful for the chance this early.''
